page.title: 09A DAY AT ST.EDWARD'S P.SCH.
page.content: On June 27th second year children from St.Edward's Primary school went to Goldhanger Field Centre (O.S. 089905). They left at 8.30 a.m. and arrived at 9.45 a.m. after travelling 34 miles. On arrival, they went down to the meadow and looked at grasses and flowers, picking examples to press. In the afternoon, they went to the creek on the Blackwater to look at the little island and wildlife. Back at the school, children were working in their classrooms on Maths and English. Two girls interviewed Pat, the cleaner, who has lived in Romford for 60 years and lives just a short distance away from the school. She said, "The area has changed tremendously, I liked it as it was, now it's too 'hubbubby' - too many cars, too noisy".
